text.tspan: Hidden Hunger Index vs. GDP per capita, 2009
Hidden Hunger Index in pre-school children versus gross domestic product (GDP) per capita, measured in 2011
international-$. Hidden Hunger Index for preschool-age children is calculated as the average of three deficiency
prevalence estimates: preschool children affected by stunting, anemia due to iron deficiency, and vitamin-A
deficiency. A higher index value indicates more severe nutritional deficiencies.
Hidden Hunger Index in pre-school children
Source: Muthayya et al. (2013); Penn World Tables
